**Remote Monitoring and Data Gathering Service Acquisition**

### Notice Type
This is an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN).

### Mandatory Requirements
Canada is seeking a supplier to establish a remote monitoring and data gathering system at the Wikwemikong First Nation. The system will be used to monitor the biomass heating installations at the Wikwemikong High School and 30 Plex (Chi-Wigwam). The supplier must have experience operating biomass heating systems at the Wikwemikong First Nation within the last 5 years, a minimum 5-year working relationship with the First Nation, and be the representative of the biomass boiler manufacturer (Froling).

### Solicitation Method
This is not a competitive process. A statement of capabilities is requested to demonstrate the supplier meets the mandatory requirements. If a qualified supplier submits a statement of capabilities, a competitive process will be triggered.

### Service Requirements
- Provide technical guidance and support to operators on the biomass heating installations
- Gather and collect data on the heating plants on two sites
- Liaise with operators to provide weekly reports
- Provide training, technical guidance, and support to system operators

### Contract Period
The contract will be for a period of 2 years, from September 2024 to July 2026.

### Contract Value
The estimated value of the contract is $62,802.61 (GST/HST extra).

### Contact Information
If interested, please contact Serge Tshimanga at **serge.tshimanga@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca**

### Closing Date and Time
The closing date and time for accepting statements of capabilities is June 28, 2024 at 14:00 HNE.
